author: Elastic
attributes.description: Identifies multiple violations of AWS Bedrock guardrails by the same user in the same account over a session. Multiple violations implies that a user may be intentionally attempting to cirvumvent security controls, access sensitive information, or possibly exploit a vulnerability in the system.
false_positives: Legitimate misunderstanding by users or overly strict policies
attributes.name: AWS Bedrock Guardrails Detected Multiple Violations by a Single User Over a Session
attributes.query:
from logs-aws_bedrock.invocation-*
| where gen_ai.compliance.violation_detected
| stats violations = count(*) by user.id, gen_ai.request.model.id, cloud.account.id
| where violations > 1
| sort violations desc
attributes.setup:
## Setup

This rule requires that guardrails are configured in AWS Bedrock. For more information, see the AWS Bedrock documentation:

https://docs.aws.amazon.com/bedrock/latest/userguide/guardrails-create.html
